case_vignette: A 60-year-old man presents to the clinic with a 1-cm long horn-like projection coming from the skin on the superior aspect of the skull just lateral to midline! The structure is yellowish-white in color and feels very firm to the touch! He states that he noticed a small, hard lesion a few months ago and that it has grown progressively larger from the time of initial presentation to now! The patient denies any pain at rest but states that he experiences pain when the lesion is struck accidentally!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a horn-like projection on my head that has been growing larger over time, and I experience pain when it is accidentally hit.
How long have you been experiencing this growth?
I noticed the small, hard lesion a few months ago.
Do you have a history of excessive sun exposure, or has there been any trauma to the area where the growth is located?
No, I don't have any history of trauma to the area where the growth is located.
Have you noticed any changes in the skin or other new symptoms around the area of the growth?
No, I haven't noticed any other new symptoms or changes in the skin around the area of the growth.
Do you have any current or past history of skin cancers or similar conditions?
I haven’t mentioned any history of skin cancers or similar conditions.
Do you have any family history of skin cancers or genetic disorders related to skin growths?
I haven’t mentioned any family history of skin cancers or genetic disorders related to skin growths.
Final Diagnosis: Cutaneous Horn
